Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How has your week been?
Hi, Ellie! It’s been a bit hectic, but I’m managing. I started planning out my study schedule.
That’s fantastic! How did that go for you?
It was a bit overwhelming at first, but once I got it down, it felt good to have a plan.
That’s great to hear! What did you include in your schedule?
I set aside three evenings a week for studying, and I also added in breaks for self-care.
That sounds balanced. How do you feel about the time you’ve allocated for self-care?
I think it’s important. I included time for walks and reading, which helps me unwind.
Those are excellent self-care activities. Have you been able to stick to your schedule so far?
Mostly, but I did miss one study session because my son had a rough day.
That’s understandable. How did you handle that situation?
I just shifted my study time to the next day and made sure to give him extra attention.
That’s a healthy response. It shows you’re being flexible while also prioritizing your son’s needs.
Thanks! I’m trying to find that balance.
It’s a process, and it sounds like you’re doing well. Have you noticed any changes in your motivation or mood since starting your studies?
I feel more energized, actually. Having a goal is really motivating for me.
That’s wonderful! It’s great to see how setting goals can positively impact your mood. Have you had a chance to talk to your mom about your boundaries?
Yes, I did! It was a bit awkward, but I think she got my point.
How did she respond?
She was defensive at first, but I think she realized I wasn’t trying to push her away.
That’s a positive outcome. It sounds like you both are making progress in your communication.
Yeah, I think so. I just hope she continues to respect my boundaries.
It may take time, but you’re setting a good foundation. Have you noticed any changes in your relationship since that conversation?
A little bit. She seems to be more supportive, which is nice.
That’s great to hear! It’s important to acknowledge those small changes. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been feeling a bit anxious about going back to school. What if I can’t handle it?
It’s completely normal to feel anxious about new challenges. What specifically worries you?
I’m just afraid of failing or not being able to keep up with everything.
Those thoughts can be daunting. Have you considered reframing those fears into more positive thoughts?
I haven’t really thought about it. What do you mean?
Instead of focusing on the possibility of failure, you could remind yourself of your strengths and past successes.
That makes sense. I have done well in my courses before.
Exactly! It’s about recognizing your capabilities. You’ve already shown resilience in parenting and your studies.
Thanks, that helps me feel a bit better.
I’m glad to hear that. Remember, it’s okay to take things one step at a time.
I will! I think breaking it down will help me feel less overwhelmed.
That’s a great strategy. Would you like to set a specific goal for your studies this week?
Sure! I want to finish the first module of my course.
That’s a solid goal. How will you track your progress?
I’ll use a planner to check off tasks as I complete them.
That sounds effective. It can be very rewarding to see your progress visually.
I’m excited to get started!
That’s the spirit! Remember to celebrate those small victories along the way.
I will! Thank you for your support, Ellie.
You’re welcome! I’m here to help. I look forward to hearing about your progress next week.
Me too! See you next time!
Take care until then!
